text:
<@UT35DSBMF> there is no native background lazy loading in browsers currently so no. That said if you were to use an image field and enable this option, you are the one who determines what to do with the fact image lazy loading was enabled. So you could use that as a way to trigger JavaScript to execute against an element with a background image.

That said that should be treated as a progressive enhancement. Native lazy loading is the better way to go.

Hi all, Anyone knows how to add space between the fields that are next to each other?
I've tried to add padding and margin and none of them work. Could someone please help me?
<https://www.carecru.com/partner?hs_preview=PMNhRJqC-37021796697>
